name: node-red-contrib-stoptimer-varidelay
description: Sends the msg through the 1st output after the timer duration. A new msg received before the timer expires will replace the existing msg and the timer will be restarted, unless the new msg has a payload of 'stop' or 'STOP', which will stop the timer. The 2nd output allows you to send a payload of a number, string or boolean. If the timer is stopped, the second output will automatically send a payload of 'stopped'. A 3rd output provides an optional output, reporting the time remaining. Configurable to be persistent across restart.
